original_title: Sri Lanka Navy and Police Net Fishing Trawler Loaded with Narcotics
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st);In a successful joint operation, the Sri Lanka Navy and Police Narcotic Bureau intercepted a local fishing trawler smuggling a significant quantity of narcotics in the southern seas off Sri Lanka.
The apprehended vessel was brought to Galle Harbor on the morning of January 5th, 2024, where a thorough investigation is currently underway.
Acting on intelligence reports, the Navy and Narcotics Bureau launched a coordinated operation, intercepting the suspect trawler while it navigated the high seas south of the island nation.
Upon inspection, authorities discovered a large cache of narcotics onboard, the exact nature and quantity of which are still under investigation.
Six individuals, including the crew of the trawler, were apprehended during the operation and are now being questioned by officials.
Myanmar has agreed to rescue the 56 Sri Lankans held against their will at a Cyber Slave Camp in Myawaddi by conducting an immediate operation
